title: Comic Relief: Arsenal fan Piers Morgan humiliated after being forced to wear rival Tottenham shirt for bet
text:
getting shirty Comic Relief: Arsenal fan Piers Morgan humiliated after being forced to wear rival Tottenham shirt for bet 
Good Morning Britain star Morgan dons kit of despised rival as Lord Sugar stumps up to raise funds for Comic Relief By Duncan Wright 24th March 2017, 2:02 pm Updated: 25th March 2017, 12:08 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PIERS MORGAN has suffered the ultimate humiliation – after being forced to wear the shirt of his bitter rivals Tottenham. 
Long-suffering Arsenal fan Morgan had to swallow his pride to pose for pictures in the colours of the club he dislikes the most. Rex Features 2 Piers Morgan suffered the ultimate humiliation in the name of raising money for Comic Relief 
The Good Morning Britain host was made to endure his worst nightmare after being forced into the act by old pal Lord Sugar in aid of Comic Relief. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news , gossip and rumours 
Morgan had pledged to embark on a 24-hour period of silence on Twitter in aid of the charity if enough people sponsored him. 2 Piers Morgan poses for a picture in the Tottenham shirt he despises 
But he was double-bluffed by ex-Spurs chairman Sugar, who said he would pay £50,000 to Comic Relief if die-hard Gunner Morgan wore the white of Tottenham. 
And having been forced into such a public corner there was no turning back for the former Britain’s Got Talent judge who delivered the goods this morning. 
But Morgan did draw the line of accepting the challenge of Spurs and England striker Harry Kane who said he would pay thousands should he kiss the cockerel badge. Lord Sugar donates £25,000 to make Arsenal fan Piers Morgan wear Tottenham shirt The best birthday present I could have asked for on my 70th, @piersmorgan gagged and wearing a Spurs shirt, brilliant! @comicrelief @GMB pic.twitter.com/efo5TsMGqW
